qas.question: What year did season four of American Idol first air?
How many contestants auditioned for the fourth season of American Idol?
What was the oldest that you could be to qualify as a contestant on the fourth season of American Idol?
What  was the first full season of American Idol to air in high definition?
In which season was Bo Bice a contestant on American Idol?
Season four was the first full season to be aired in what?
How many people auditioned to be on American Idol?
What was the maximum age a contestant could be starting this season?

context: <a3_0><a4_0>Season four<a4_0/><a3_0/> premiered on <a5_0>January 18, <a0_0>2005<a5_0/><a0_0/>; this was the first season of the series to be aired in <a6_0>high definition<a6_0/>, although the finale of season three was also aired in high definition. The number of those attending the auditions by now had increased to <a1_0><a7_0>over 100,000<a7_0/><a1_0/> from the 10,000 of the first season. The age limit was raised to <a2_0><a8_0>28<a8_0/><a2_0/> in this season, and among those who benefited from this new rule were Constantine Maroulis and Bo Bice, the two rockers of the show.
